title: Lehecka passes Cilic test in Belgrade: 'He hasn't forgotten how to play'
description: Jiri Lehecka delivered a statement performance against Marin Cilic on Tuesday at the Belgrade Open to serve up some Czech history. The fourth seed powered to a 6-4, 7-6(4) victory, becoming the first Czech player to reach seven ATP Tour quarter-finals in one season since Tomas Berdych in 2017. With the one-hour, 43-minute win, Lehecka extended his perfect record against opponents outside the Top 100 in the PIF ATP Rankings to 8-0. ‚ÄúHe didn‚Äôt forget how to play,‚Äù Lehecka said of Cilic, the former World No. 3. ‚ÄúWe saw that today, it was a good test for me. It‚Äôs always a good win against a very experienced player, a Grand Slam champion, so I‚Äôm very happy.‚Äù [ATP APP] Lehecka was ruthless on serve throughout the match, during which he won 89 per cent (33/37) points behind his first delivery, according to Infosys ATP Stats. In the last eight, the 22-year-old will face qualifier Lukas Klein, who earlier upset seventh seed Tomas Martin Etcheverry 6-4, 7-6(8). Elsewhere, Hamad Medjedovic continued his return to form with a hard-fought win over Aleksandar Kovacevic to advance to his third tour-level quarter-final. The wild card did not face a single break point, en route to a 7-6(5), 6-4 triumph. Say hello to your first quarter-finalist in Belgrade üëã üá∑üá∏@MedjedovicHamad is through to his 3‚É£rd ATP QF with a straight sets win over Kovacevic 7-6(5) 6-4#BelgradeOpen pic.twitter.com/G1xWG6keMl ‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) November 5, 2024 ‚ÄúI was a bit tight in my first match [against Brandon Nakashima]," said Medjedovic, the reigning Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF champion. ‚ÄúBut now I have got into the rhythm, I am feeling great with the home crowd and I‚Äôm really enjoying it.‚Äù Medjedovic will face either third seed Francisco Cerundolo or Roman Safiullin, who earlier secured his 50th tour-level win by defeating Fabio Fognini 6-3, 6-3. On a day of Serbian success, Laslo Djere won the battle of two wild cards with a commanding 6-4, 6-4 victory over Stan Wawrinka. The 29-year-old, who notched his third tour-level win on home soil, will face lucky loser Duje Ajdukovic in the second round. [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: Jiri Lehecka delivered a statement performance on Tuesday in his opening-round clash with Marin Cilic at the Belgrade Open.

html:
Match Report

Lehecka passes Cilic test in Belgrade: 'He hasn't forgotten how to play'

Medjedovic, Djere advance at indoor hard-court ATP 250¬†

November 05, 2024

Mike Lawrence/ATP Tour

Jiri Lehecka advances to his seventh ATP Tour quarter-final of 2024 at the Belgrade Open. (file photo) By ATP Staff

Jiri Lehecka delivered a statement performance against Marin Cilic on Tuesday at the Belgrade Open to serve up some Czech history.

The fourth seed powered to a 6-4, 7-6(4) victory, becoming the first Czech player to reach seven ATP Tour quarter-finals in one season since Tomas Berdych in 2017. With the one-hour, 43-minute win, Lehecka extended his perfect record against opponents outside the Top 100 in the PIF ATP Rankings to 8-0.

‚ÄúHe didn‚Äôt forget how to play,‚Äù Lehecka said of Cilic, the former World No. 3. ‚ÄúWe saw that today, it was a good test for me. It‚Äôs always a good win against a very experienced player, a Grand Slam champion, so I‚Äôm very happy.‚Äù

Lehecka was ruthless on serve throughout the match, during which he won 89 per cent (33/37) points behind his first delivery, according to Infosys ATP Stats. In the last eight, the 22-year-old will face qualifier Lukas Klein, who earlier upset seventh seed Tomas Martin Etcheverry 6-4, 7-6(8).

Elsewhere, Hamad Medjedovic continued his return to form with a hard-fought win over Aleksandar Kovacevic to advance to his third tour-level quarter-final. The wild card did not face a single break point, en route to a 7-6(5), 6-4 triumph.

Say hello to your first quarter-finalist in Belgrade üëã üá∑üá∏@MedjedovicHamad is through to his 3‚É£rd ATP QF with a straight sets win over Kovacevic 7-6(5) 6-4#BelgradeOpen pic.twitter.com/G1xWG6keMl

‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) November 5, 2024

‚ÄúI was a bit tight in my first match [against Brandon Nakashima]," said Medjedovic, the reigning Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF champion. ‚ÄúBut now I have got into the rhythm, I am feeling great with the home crowd and I‚Äôm really enjoying it.‚Äù

Medjedovic will face either third seed Francisco Cerundolo or Roman Safiullin, who earlier secured his 50th tour-level win by defeating Fabio Fognini 6-3, 6-3.

On a day of Serbian success, Laslo Djere won the battle of two wild cards with a commanding 6-4, 6-4 victory over Stan Wawrinka. The 29-year-old, who notched his third tour-level win on home soil, will face lucky loser Duje Ajdukovic in the second round.
